entities.name: Key Performance Indicators
entities.description: Measurable values that demonstrate effectiveness in ecommerce.

attributes.definition: Regularly assessing your key performance indicators (KPI) is essential for meeting profit targets, remaining competitive, and growing your business.

entities.name: Ecommerce
entities.description: Business area focused on online sales and marketing.

entities.name: Customer Data Platform
entities.description: System used for managing customer data and analytics.

entities.name: Cost Per Click
entities.description: The amount spent on advertising divided by the number of clicks received.

attributes.definition: Cost Per Click is a metric that measures the cost incurred for each click on an advertisement.

entities.name: Cost Per Conversion
entities.description: The total cost of acquiring a customer divided by the number of conversions.

attributes.definition: Cost Per Conversion measures the cost associated with converting a lead into a customer.

entities.name: Number of Leads
entities.description: The total number of potential customers who have shown interest in a product or service.

attributes.definition: Number of Leads refers to the count of individuals or organizations that have expressed interest in a company's offerings.

entities.name: Piwik PRO
entities.description: A platform for analyzing ecommerce KPIs.

entities.name: Ecommerce
entities.description: Business area focused on buying and selling goods and services online.

entities.name: Returning Visitors
entities.description: Metric to determine how many people have visited and returned to a website.

attributes.definition: Calculated by dividing the number of repeat visitors by the total number of unique visitors in a given time period.

entities.name: Cart-to-Detail Rate
entities.description: Ratio of cart additions to views of the product page.

attributes.formula: Number of unique products added to cart / Number of times product pages have been visited

entities.name: Abandoned Cart Percentage
entities.description: Measures the percentage of sessions that had an interaction with a cart but no order.

attributes.definition: Also known as the abandonment rate.

entities.name: Cart Abandonment Rate
entities.description: Average online shopping cart abandonment rate.

attributes.definition: The average online shopping cart abandonment rate is 70.19%.

entities.name: Site Search Usage
entities.description: Analyzes how visitors use the site’s search function.

attributes.definition: Includes the search terms entered and the impact of search results on engagement.

entities.name: Cart-to-Detail Rate Improvement
entities.description: Improvement in cart-to-detail rate through better product information.

attributes.definition: Providing detailed product information can lead to a high cart-to-detail rate.

entities.name: Advertising Campaign Success
entities.description: Measures the success or performance of an advertising campaign.

attributes.definition: A Key Performance Indicator (KPI) that measures the success or performance of an advertising campaign.

entities.name: Ecommerce Key Performance Indicators
entities.description: KPIs specifically related to ecommerce performance.

attributes.definition: Metrics that help in evaluating the performance of ecommerce activities.

entities.description: Reports that track events in the ecommerce funnel.

entities.description: A funnel-based report analyzing customer journey.

entities.name: Online Marketing
entities.description: Business area focused on marketing strategies in the online space.

entities.name: Ecommerce Analytics
entities.description: Analytics focused on ecommerce performance and customer behavior.

entities.name: Customer Journey
entities.description: Data structure that maps the entire customer journey based on behavioral segmentation.

entities.name: Customer Lifetime Value (CLV)
entities.description: Total revenue a customer generates over their relationship with the company

entities.name: Average Order Value by Channel
entities.description: Average revenue generated per order across different channels

entities.name: Revenue per Visitor (RPV)
entities.description: Revenue generated per visitor to the ecommerce site

entities.name: Cart Abandonment Rate
entities.description: Percentage of shopping carts that are abandoned before purchase

entities.name: Repeat Purchase Rate (RPR)
entities.description: Percentage of customers who make more than one purchase

entities.description: Table representing the stages of the ecommerce funnel

entities.description: Source or medium through which traffic arrives at the ecommerce site

entities.description: Number of sessions generated from organic search traffic

entities.description: Percentage of users who click on a link compared to the total users who view a page

entities.name: Ecommerce
entities.description: Business area focused on online sales and customer interactions

entities.name: Average Order Value
entities.description: The average value of each order placed through a specific channel over a set period.

attributes.definition: Average Order Value is calculated by dividing the revenue by the number of orders.

entities.description: Calculation method for Average Order Value.

entities.name: Orders New vs. Returning
entities.description: Tracking the ratio of orders from new and returning customers.

attributes.definition: Essential to gauge the success of marketing efforts and loyalty programs.

entities.name: Revenue by Product
entities.description: Percentage of total revenue generated by a particular product.

attributes.definition: Helps identify the products with the highest sales.

entities.name: Ecommerce
entities.description: Business area focused on online sales and marketing.

entities.name: Traffic Source/Medium
entities.description: Indicates where new visitors come from and how they engage with the website.

attributes.definition: The source refers to the starting point of your website’s visitors, such as a search engine or a specific domain.

entities.name: Organic Traffic Sessions
entities.description: Measures the number of sessions initiated by visitors coming from organic search results.

attributes.definition: Tracks the number of website visitors who found your link through a search engine result page rather than through paid ads.

entities.description: Business area focused on online sales and marketing.

entities.description: Insight into the number of visitors discovering the site through search engines.

entities.description: Field related to web analytics tools and comparisons.

entities.name: Maximizing Funnel Performance
entities.description: Key performance indicator for ecommerce funnel optimization.

entities.description: Tracking the topics and search terms on your website that attract the most traffic.

attributes.definition: Helps understand the most relevant and high-impact keywords.

entities.name: Click-Through Rate (CTR)
entities.description: Measures the number of users who clicked a link compared to the number of impressions.

attributes.definition: Indicates how well content and marketing campaigns reach the target audience.

entities.name: Engagement Rate
entities.description: Evaluates the level of engagement with a product or content.

attributes.definition: A high engagement rate can result in more clicks and conversions.

entities.name: Bounce Rate
entities.description: Percentage of people who enter a single page and leave without further action.

attributes.definition: Indicates the success of a single landing page.

entities.name: Bounce Rate Calculation
entities.description: Calculated measure of bounce rate.

attributes.formula: Bounce Rate = Single-Page Sessions / All Sessions

entities.description: Business area focusing on key performance indicators for ecommerce.

entities.description: Field related to data analysis and performance measurement.

entities.description: Sector dealing with financial services and products.

entities.description: Area focused on protecting data and ensuring compliance with regulations.

entities.name: Customer Data Platform
entities.description: A system that consolidates customer data from various sources.

entities.name: Return on Investment (ROI)
entities.description: Indicates the amount gained or lost in comparison to the initial investment.

attributes.definition: ROI is a crucial metric for your business, indicating the amount gained (positive ROI) or lost (negative ROI) in comparison to the initial investment.
attributes.formula: Gain or net benefits earned / Cost paid

entities.name: Repeat Purchase Rate (RPR)
entities.description: Measures customer loyalty and satisfaction based on repeat purchases.

attributes.definition: A high RPR indicates that your customers are happy with your products, services, and overall experience.

entities.name: Ecommerce Analytics
entities.description: Business area focused on analyzing ecommerce performance and customer behavior.

entities.name: Piwik PRO
entities.description: Analytics platform for ecommerce that provides insights into KPIs and customer behavior.

entities.name: Revenue per Visitor
entities.description: Measures the revenue generated by the business from each customer visit.

attributes.definition: Revenue per Visitor is calculated by dividing total revenue by the number of website visitors during a given timeframe.

entities.name: Customer Lifetime Value
entities.description: Reflects the total profits customers generate throughout their interactions with the company.

attributes.definition: Customer Lifetime Value is calculated by multiplying the average purchase value, purchase frequency, and customer lifespan.

entities.name: Repeat Purchase Rate
entities.description: Measures how many customers make multiple purchases with a company.

attributes.definition: Repeat Purchase Rate is calculated by analyzing the number of repeat customers and dividing it by the total number of customers.

entities.name: Average Days Between Transactions
entities.description: Measures the time gap between a customer’s initial and subsequent purchases.

attributes.definition: Average Days Between Transactions provides valuable information about customer behavior.

entities.name: Top-Bought Products
entities.description: Evaluates the most popular products in terms of volume and revenue.

attributes.definition: Top-Bought Products KPI allows you to see your most popular products in a given period.

entities.description: A web analytics service that tracks and reports website traffic.

entities.description: The name of the Google Analytics account.

entities.description: The name of the website being tracked.

entities.description: The web address of the website being tracked.

entities.description: The industry category of the website.

entities.description: The time zone setting for the Google Analytics account.

entities.description: Settings that determine how data is shared from Google Analytics.

entities.description: JavaScript code added to web pages for tracking.

entities.description: Identifier for the tracking code in Google Analytics.

entities.name: Average Order Value
entities.description: Calculates the average money spent by a customer when they place an order.

entities.name: Average Order Value (AOV)
entities.description: A metric that indicates the average amount spent per order.

entities.name: Cost Per Lead (CPL)
entities.description: A key performance indicator that measures the cost-effectiveness of generating leads through various channels.

attributes.definition: CPL is calculated to determine which channels generate the most leads.

entities.name: Marketing
entities.description: The business area focused on promoting and selling products or services.

entities.name: Customer Acquisition Cost
entities.description: Measures the amount spent in sales and marketing to gain one new customer for a particular period.

attributes.definition: The customer acquisition cost (CAC) measures the amount spent in sales and marketing to gain one new customer for a particular period.

entities.name: Customer Acquisition Cost Formula
entities.description: Formula used to calculate Customer Acquisition Cost.

attributes.expression: Total Sales and Marketing Costs / Number of New Customers

entities.name: ayeT-Studios
entities.description: Source of information regarding customer acquisition cost.

entities.name: Sales & Marketing
entities.description: Business area related to customer acquisition.

entities.name: Click-Through Rate
entities.description: The percentage of people who clicked and viewed your link, email, or post.

attributes.definition: The ratio of clicks to the total number of impressions on the landing page or email.

entities.name: Click-Through Rate
entities.description: A calculated measure of the effectiveness of marketing campaigns.

entities.name: Marketing
entities.description: The business area related to marketing campaigns and their effectiveness.

entities.name: Net Promoter Score (NPS)
entities.description: A metric used to gauge customer loyalty and satisfaction based on survey responses.

attributes.definition: NPS is calculated based on customer responses to survey questions, classifying them into Promoters, Passives, and Detractors.

entities.name: Promoters
entities.description: Customers who score 9-10 on the NPS survey.

entities.name: Passives
entities.description: Customers who score 7-8 on the NPS survey.

entities.name: Detractors
entities.description: Customers who score 0-6 on the NPS survey.

entities.name: Google Analytics
entities.description: A popular web analytics tool used for tracking website traffic and user behavior.

entities.name: Website Traffic
entities.description: The amount of data sent and received by visitors to a website.

entities.name: User Behavior
entities.description: The actions taken by users on a website, which can be tracked and analyzed.

entities.name: Tracking ID
entities.description: A unique identifier used to track activities and user behavior on a website.

entities.name: Repeat Purchase Rate
entities.description: Measure of the percentage of customers who have made repeat purchases from your brand within a specified period.

attributes.definition: The percentage of customers who have made repeat purchases from your brand within a specified period.

entities.name: Repeat Purchase Rate Calculation
entities.description: Calculation method for determining the Repeat Purchase Rate.

attributes.formula: Number of Repeat Purchases / Total Customers * 100

entities.description: Business area focusing on customer satisfaction and loyalty.

entities.description: Total revenue a customer generates over their relationship with the company.

entities.description: A session that meets specific engagement criteria.

attributes.formula: Lasts more than 10 seconds OR Contains one or more page view OR One or more conversion event
